awd_titl_txt: On Foundational Issues in Computer Science
awd_abstract_narration: This project concentrates on three areas:           (1)  Average-case complexity: Tuning up the average-case  reduction theory, finding  more average-case complete  problems, and proving average-case hardness of real-  life problems;           (2) Finite model theory: Investigating whether  semantical  properties (such as monotonicity) have any syntactic  characterizations on finite structures, determining  whether parts of polynomial  time properties can be  captured by polynomial-time-bounded logics, and  studying finite structures with weights in infinite  structures (such as  arithmetic);           (3) Evolving algebras: Examining a new computation model  (evolving algebras) in order to use these algebras to  specify and verify  real-life algorithms.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
